plants.name: Aglaonema
plants.description: Also known as Chinese Evergreen, it's a popular decorative plant with large, glossy oval-shaped leaves.
instruction: Prefers low to medium indirect light and well-drained, peaty soil. Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
benefits: Noted in your list as an 'excellent air purifier'.

plants.name: Aloe Vera
plants.description: A succulent plant species of the genus Aloe, widely known for its thick, fleshy leaves.
instruction: Requires bright, indirect sunlight and sandy, well-draining soil. Water deeply but allow soil to dry out between waterings.
benefits: The gel from its leaves is widely used for soothing skin burns, and it has various other medicinal applications.

plants.name: Amla (Indian Gooseberry)
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its small, tart, green fruits.
instruction: Grows best in deep, fertile soil with good drainage. Requires full sunlight.
benefits: Extremely rich in Vitamin C, it's a cornerstone of traditional Ayurvedic medicine.

plants.name: Anise
plants.description: A flowering plant in the parsley family, known for its sweet, aromatic seeds that have a licorice-like flavor.
instruction: Plant in light, fertile, well-drained soil in a sunny location.
benefits: Widely used as a culinary spice in baking and drinks. Also used for digestive health.

plants.name: Areca Palm
plants.description: A popular indoor palm with arching fronds, giving it a lush, tropical appearance.
instruction: Prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Keep the soil lightly moist.
benefits: Acts as a natural air humidifier and is effective at removing airborne toxins.

plants.name: Arjuna
plants.description: A large, evergreen tree, primarily found in the Indian subcontinent.
instruction: Requires deep, moist alluvial loam and is often found along riverbanks. Needs ample space and sunlight to grow.
benefits: The bark is used in traditional medicine, primarily for cardiovascular health.

plants.name: Ashwagandha
plants.description: An evergreen shrub in the nightshade family, also known as 'Indian Ginseng'.
instruction: Grows in dry, stony soil with plenty of sun. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant.
benefits: A popular adaptogen used in Ayurvedic medicine to reduce stress and anxiety.

plants.name: Babyl
plants.description: A type of fodder grass or legume used for animal feed.
instruction: Typically sown in prepared fields and requires conditions suitable for pasture grasses.
benefits: Provides nutritious forage for livestock.

plants.name: Bamboo
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen perennial in the grass family, known for its strong, hollow stems.
instruction: Thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Some species can be invasive, so containment is recommended.
benefits: Extremely versatile industrial material used for construction, textiles, paper, and food.

plants.name: Banana
plants.description: An elongated, edible fruit produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants.
instruction: Requires rich, fertile soil, high humidity, and consistent moisture in a warm, sunny climate.
benefits: A staple food source rich in potassium and dietary fiber.

plants.name: Barley
plants.description: A major cereal grain, a member of the grass family.
instruction: A hardy crop that can grow in a variety of climates. Planted in spring or fall.
benefits: Used as animal fodder, for malting in beer and whiskey production, and in various food products.

plants.name: Basil
plants.description: A culinary herb of the mint family, known for its aromatic leaves.
instruction: Plant in a sunny location with well-drained soil. Water regularly and pinch back tips to encourage bushy growth.
benefits: A popular culinary herb, especially in Italian cuisine. Also has medicinal uses due to its antioxidant properties.

plants.name: Black Pepper
plants.description: A flowering vine cultivated for its fruit, which is dried and used as a spice and seasoning.
instruction: Requires a hot, humid climate with plenty of rain and support structures to climb.
benefits: One of the world's most traded spices, used to add flavor to nearly any savory dish.

plants.name: Bougainvillea
plants.description: A genus of thorny ornamental vines and bushes known for their colorful, paper-like bracts that surround the actual flower.
instruction: Thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is drought-tolerant once established.
benefits: A vibrant and hardy decorative plant, perfect for adding color to gardens and walls.

plants.name: Brahmi
plants.description: A perennial, non-aromatic herb that typically grows in wet, tropical environments.
instruction: Can be grown in boggy soil or even in shallow water, in a partially shaded location.
benefits: Used in Ayurvedic medicine as a memory enhancer and to support cognitive function.

plants.name: Cardamom
plants.description: A spice made from the seeds of several plants in the ginger family, known for its intense, aromatic flavor.
instruction: Grows in the shade of tall forest trees in humid, tropical climates.
benefits: A common ingredient in Indian and Middle Eastern cooking, used in both sweet and savory dishes.

plants.name: Carrot
plants.description: A root vegetable, typically orange in color, though other colors exist.
instruction: Plant in loose, sandy soil to allow the root to grow straight. Keep soil moist.
benefits: Excellent source of Vitamin A (from beta-carotene), fiber, and antioxidants.

plants.name: Cast-Iron Plant
plants.description: An extremely hardy houseplant with large, arching, dark green leaves.
instruction: Tolerates very low light and infrequent watering, making it ideal for beginners.
benefits: Known for its ability to survive in conditions where other plants would not, adding greenery to difficult spots.

plants.name: Cauliflower
plants.description: A vegetable in the Brassicaceae family, which also includes broccoli and cabbage. The head, or 'curd', is the edible part.
instruction: A cool-season crop that requires consistent moisture and fertile soil.
benefits: Rich in vitamins C and K and a good source of fiber.

plants.name: Cereus
plants.description: A genus of large, columnar cacti, many of which are night-blooming.
instruction: Requires full sun and very well-draining soil. Water sparingly, especially in winter.
benefits: Striking architectural plants for desert landscaping and large containers.

plants.name: Chili
plants.description: The fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, known for its spicy heat.
instruction: Plant in a sunny, warm location with well-drained soil. Water regularly.
benefits: A fundamental spice in many cuisines worldwide, providing flavor and heat.

plants.name: Cinnamon
plants.description: A spice obtained from the inner bark of several tree species from the genus Cinnamomum.
instruction: The trees are grown for two years and then coppiced, with the bark harvested from the resulting shoots.
benefits: Used in both sweet and savory foods, valued for its warm, aromatic flavor and potential health benefitss.

plants.name: Clove
plants.description: The aromatic flower buds of a tree in the family Myrtaceae.
instruction: Clove trees grow in tropical climates and require high rainfall.
benefits: A pungent, warming spice used in cooking and baking. Also has antiseptic and analgesic properties.

plants.name: Cluster Bean (Guar)
plants.description: An annual legume, the plant is a valuable source of guar gum.
instruction: A hardy, drought-tolerant crop that grows well in sandy soils.
benefits: Primarily grown as fodder for livestock and for the production of guar gum, a key industrial thickener.

plants.name: Cocoa
plants.description: The dried and fermented seed of Theobroma cacao, from which chocolate is made.
instruction: The cacao tree grows in the understory of tropical rainforests, requiring shade and high humidity.
benefits: The primary ingredient for chocolate. Rich in antioxidants.

plants.name: Coconut
plants.description: The fruit of the coconut palm, valued for its water, milk, oil, and meat.
instruction: Coconut palms thrive in sandy soils and require high humidity and regular rainfall in tropical climates.
benefits: A highly versatile plant providing food, drink, and oil. The husk is used for coir fiber.

plants.name: Coffee
plants.description: A brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
instruction: Coffee plants are typically grown in shaded, high-altitude regions in a belt around the equator.
benefits: One of the world's most popular beverages, known for its stimulating effect due to caffeine.

plants.name: Coir
plants.description: A natural fiber extracted from the outer husk of coconuts.
instruction: This is a product derived from the coconut plant, not a plant itself.
benefits: Used to make ropes, mats, brushes, and as a growing medium in horticulture.

plants.name: Coriander
plants.description: An annual herb in the celery family. All parts are edible, but the fresh leaves (cilantro) and dried seeds are most common.
instruction: Grows best in a sunny spot with well-drained soil. It has a short life cycle.
benefits: A versatile herb and spice used in cuisines globally. Also known for its digestive and antioxidant medicinal properties.

plants.name: Cotton
plants.description: A soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll around the seeds of the cotton plants.
instruction: Requires a long, warm growing season with plenty of sunshine and moderate rainfall.
benefits: The world's most important natural textile fiber. Cottonseed is used for oil and animal feed.

plants.name: Cowpea
plants.description: A type of bean, one of the most important food legume crops in the semi-arid tropics.
instruction: A heat-loving and drought-tolerant crop that can fix nitrogen in the soil.
benefits: Cultivated for its edible beans and leaves, and used as nutritious fodder for livestock.

plants.name: Crown of Thorns
plants.description: A species of Euphorbia, a succulent shrub known for its woody, spiny stems and colorful flower bracts.
instruction: Prefers full sun and well-draining soil. Water when the soil is dry to the touch. Be cautious of the milky sap.
benefits: A popular, low-maintenance ornamental plant that can bloom year-round in the right conditions.

plants.name: Cumin
plants.description: A flowering plant in the parsley family whose seeds are used as a spice.
instruction: A drought-tolerant, tropical or sub-tropical crop. Requires a hot summer of three to four months.
benefits: An essential spice in many cuisines, especially in Latin American, Middle Eastern, and Indian food.

plants.name: Date Palm
plants.description: A palm tree cultivated for its edible sweet fruit.
instruction: Grows in hot, arid climates and requires abundant water at its roots.
benefits: Produces dates, a highly nutritious fruit. The fronds are used for weaving, providing a source of fiber.

plants.name: Euphorbia
plants.description: A very large and diverse genus of flowering plants, ranging from tiny annuals to large trees, many of which are succulents.
instruction: Care varies widely by species, but most succulent types need bright light and minimal water.
benefits: Many species are grown as ornamentals for their unique forms and flowers.

plants.name: Fenugreek
plants.description: An annual plant in the family Fabaceae, with leaves consisting of three small obovate to oblong leaflets.
instruction: Grows well in full sun and well-drained, loamy soil.
benefits: The seeds are used as a spice, and the leaves are used as a fresh herb. It's also used for medicinal purposes.

plants.name: Flax
plants.description: A food and fiber crop that is grown in cooler regions of the world.
instruction: Plant in early spring in well-drained soil with full sun.
benefits: The source of linen fiber for textiles. Its seeds (flaxseed) are consumed for their high nutritional value and oil.

plants.name: Garlic
plants.description: A species in the onion genus, Allium, known for its pungent flavor and aroma.
instruction: Plant individual cloves in fall for a summer harvest. Requires full sun and fertile soil.
benefits: A staple cooking spice with significant medicinal properties, including antibacterial and cardiovascular benefitss.

plants.name: Giloy (Tinospora cordifolia)
plants.description: A large, deciduous climbing shrub with a long history of use in traditional medicine.
instruction: A hardy plant that can be grown easily by stem cuttings. It needs support to climb.
benefits: Considered a powerful immune-booster in Ayurveda and used to treat a wide range of health conditions.

plants.name: Ginger
plants.description: A flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine.
instruction: Grows best in a warm, humid location with partial shade and rich, moist soil.
benefits: A pungent and warming spice for cooking. Well-known for its medicinal ability to treat nausea and inflammation.

plants.name: Golden Barrel Cactus
plants.description: A species of cactus known for its striking spherical shape and sharp yellow spines.
instruction: Requires plenty of direct sunlight and sandy, well-draining soil. Water very sparingly.
benefits: A highly popular ornamental plant for xeriscaping and container gardens due to its low maintenance.

plants.name: Grapes
plants.description: A fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.
instruction: Grow on vines that require trellising. Need full sun and well-drained soil. Pruning is essential.
benefits: Eaten fresh, dried as raisins, or fermented to make wine and other beverages.

plants.name: Groundnut (Peanut)
plants.description: A legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds.
instruction: Requires a long, warm growing season. The pods develop underground.
benefits: A major source of cooking oil. The high-protein meal is used as animal feed. A key industrial oilseed crop.

plants.name: Guinea Grass
plants.description: A tall, perennial grass that is widely cultivated as a pasture grass.
instruction: Can be established from seeds or cuttings. It is adaptable to various soil types.
benefits: A high-quality and high-yield fodder grass for grazing animals.

plants.name: Haworthia
plants.description: A large genus of small succulent plants, often resembling miniature aloes, with distinctive leaf patterns.
instruction: Prefers bright, indirect light and infrequent watering. Use a gritty, well-draining soil mix.
benefits: Popular as low-maintenance, decorative houseplants, perfect for small spaces.

plants.name: Hibiscus
plants.description: A genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, known for their large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers.
instruction: Thrives in full sun with moist, well-drained soil. Regular watering is needed for best blooms.
benefits: A beautiful ornamental plant. Your notes also mention its 'medicinal property,' as its flowers are used to make herbal tea.

plants.name: Jade Plant
plants.description: A popular succulent houseplant with thick, woody stems and fleshy, glossy green leaves.
instruction: Needs bright light and well-draining soil. Water thoroughly, then allow the soil to dry out completely before watering again.
benefits: A low-maintenance, long-lasting houseplant. Noted in your list as an 'air purifier'.

plants.name: Jowar (Sorghum)
plants.description: A genus of flowering plants in the grass family, cultivated for grain and fodder.
instruction: A drought-tolerant crop that grows well in hot, arid regions.
benefits: The grain is a staple food in many parts of the world, and the entire plant is used as animal fodder.

plants.name: Jute
plants.description: A long, soft, shiny bast fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads.
instruction: A rainy season crop that grows best in warm, humid climates.
benefits: A key industrial fiber, second only to cotton, used for making burlap, twine, and other textiles.

plants.name: Kale
plants.description: A leafy green vegetable in the cabbage family, with green or purple leaves.
instruction: A cool-season crop that grows best in well-drained, fertile soil.
benefits: A highly nutritious superfood, rich in vitamins A, C, and K, as well as antioxidants.

plants.name: Kenaf
plants.description: A plant in the mallow family, cultivated for its fiber.
instruction: A fast-growing plant that requires a warm season to mature.
benefits: The fiber is used in the production of paper, rope, and insulation materials.

plants.name: Lemon
plants.description: A species of small evergreen tree whose fruit is used for culinary and non-culinary purposes throughout the world.
instruction: Grow in a sunny, protected location with well-drained soil. Requires regular watering.
benefits: The juice is widely used to make beverages like lemonade and to flavor foods. Excellent source of Vitamin C.

plants.name: Mahua
plants.description: An Indian tropical tree grown for its oil-rich seeds and sweet, fleshy flowers.
instruction: A hardy, drought-resistant tree that grows well in dry, tropical climates.
benefits: The non-edible oil from its seeds is used for soap making and lighting. The flowers are edible and used to produce a traditional alcoholic drink.

plants.name: Maize (Corn)
plants.description: A tall annual cereal grass that yields large grains, or kernels, set in rows on a cob.
instruction: Plant in blocks for better pollination. Requires rich soil, full sun, and consistent watering.
benefits: A staple food, a key ingredient in livestock fodder, and used industrially for biofuels and bioplastics.

plants.name: Mammillaria
plants.description: One of the largest genera in the cactus family, known for its small, round shape and nipple-like tubercles.
instruction: Requires bright light and well-draining cactus mix. Water sparingly.
benefits: Popular and easy-to-grow cacti for collectors and beginners, available in many varieties.

plants.name: Marigold
plants.description: A hardy, annual plant known for its cheerful, brightly colored flowers.
instruction: Easy to grow from seed. Plant in a sunny spot with moderately fertile, well-drained soil.
benefits: A vibrant decorative flower. Your notes highlight its use as a 'natural insect repellent' in gardens.

plants.name: Millets
plants.description: A group of highly variable small-seeded grasses, widely grown around the world as cereal crops.
instruction: Hardy, drought-resistant crops that are well-suited for semi-arid regions.
benefits: A staple food in parts of Asia and Africa. Also used for animal fodder. They are gluten-free and nutritious.

plants.name: Money Plant (Pothos)
plants.description: A popular, trailing vine houseplant with heart-shaped leaves, often variegated with yellow or white.
instruction: Extremely easy to care for. Thrives in a variety of light conditions and is tolerant of neglect.
benefits: Famously known as an excellent 'air purifier'. Also believed to bring good luck.

plants.name: Moon Cactus
plants.description: A unique type of cactus that is actually two cacti grafted together: a colorful Gymnocalycium top on a rootstock base.
instruction: Prefers bright, indirect light and minimal watering. The colorful top cannot survive on its own.
benefits: A popular and colorful novelty houseplant that adds a pop of color to any collection.

plants.name: Mustard
plants.description: A plant species in the genera Brassica and Sinapis, cultivated for their small round seeds and leaves.
instruction: A cool-season crop that can be grown quickly from seed.
benefits: The seeds are used to make mustard condiment and mustard oil. The leaves are eaten as greens. A key industrial oilseed.

plants.name: Neem
plants.description: A fast-growing tree of the mahogany family, known for its bitter leaves and versatile properties.
instruction: A hardy, drought-resistant tree. Plant in a sunny spot with well-draining soil.
benefits: Valued for its medicinal properties and as a natural pesticide in industrial agriculture.

plants.name: Niger
plants.description: An oilseed crop, grown for its edible oil and seeds.
instruction: Grown in light soils in subtropical regions. It requires moderate rainfall.
benefits: The seeds produce a high-quality oil. It is also used in birdseed mixes. Your notes highlight its industrial use.

plants.name: Oat
plants.description: A species of cereal grain grown for its seed, which is known by the same name.
instruction: A cool-season crop that performs well in moist climates.
benefits: Primarily grown as livestock fodder. Also processed into rolled oats (oatmeal) for human consumption.

plants.name: Oil Palm
plants.description: A species of palm commonly referred to as the African oil palm, it is the principal source of palm oil.
instruction: Requires a tropical climate with high rainfall and humidity.
benefits: The world's most productive oil crop, producing palm oil used in a vast range of food and consumer products.

plants.name: Okra
plants.description: A flowering plant in the mallow family valued for its edible green seed pods.
instruction: A warm-season vegetable that needs full sun and fertile, well-drained soil.
benefits: A common vegetable in Southern US, Caribbean, and Indian cuisines, known for its unique texture.

plants.name: Opuntia (Prickly Pear)
plants.description: A genus in the cactus family, characterized by its flat, fleshy pads (cladodes).
instruction: Extremely drought-tolerant. Plant in full sun and very well-draining soil.
benefits: An ornamental plant for arid gardens. The pads (nopales) and fruit (tuna) of some species are edible.

plants.name: Orchids
plants.description: A diverse and widespread family of flowering plants with blooms that are often colorful and fragrant.
instruction: Care varies greatly by species. Most common types need bright, indirect light and a special orchid potting mix.
benefits: Highly prized as ornamental plants for their exotic and beautiful flowers.

plants.name: Papaya
plants.description: The fruit of the plant Carica papaya, a large, tree-like plant.
instruction: A tropical plant that needs plenty of sunlight, heat, and moisture.
benefits: A sweet, fleshy fruit rich in vitamins. Contains the enzyme papain, used as a meat tenderizer.

plants.name: Para Grass
plants.description: A species of grass known as a valuable pasture and fodder grass.
instruction: A perennial grass that thrives in wet, marshy areas in tropical climates.
benefits: A highly palatable and productive fodder for cattle, especially in wet regions.

plants.name: Pea
plants.description: A small spherical seed of the pod fruit Pisum sativum.
instruction: A cool-season crop. Plant in early spring in well-drained soil and provide support for climbing varieties.
benefits: A common vegetable, eaten cooked or raw. A good source of protein and fiber.

plants.name: Peace Lily
plants.description: A popular indoor plant with dark green leaves and unique white flowers called spathes.
instruction: Thrives in indirect light and consistently moist soil. Avoid overwatering.
benefits: Noted as an 'air purifier' that removes toxins. It is important to note, as you did, that it is 'toxic to cats'.

plants.name: Peppermint
plants.description: A hybrid mint, a cross between watermint and spearmint. An aromatic herb in the mint family.
instruction: Spreads vigorously. Plant in a container or with root barriers in moist soil with partial shade.
benefits: Used for flavoring and in herbal tea. Its oil is widely used for medicinal purposes, especially for digestion.

plants.name: Pineapple
plants.description: A tropical plant with an edible fruit, consisting of coalesced berries.
instruction: Grows from a crown cutting. Requires well-drained, acidic soil and a warm, sunny climate.
benefits: A popular tropical fruit. The leaves are the source of piña fiber, a strong, fine textile fiber.

plants.name: Pomegranate
plants.description: A fruit-bearing deciduous shrub or small tree that produces a round fruit with a hard, reddish peel and juicy, edible arils.
instruction: A drought-tolerant plant that requires hot summers to fruit well. Plant in full sun.
benefits: The seeds are rich in antioxidants and vitamins. Used in cooking, juice, and traditional medicine.

plants.name: Potato
plants.description: A starchy root vegetable that is one of the world's most common food staples.
instruction: Plant seed potatoes in loose, well-drained soil. Keep the soil consistently moist.
benefits: A key food source rich in potassium and Vitamin C. Also used industrially to produce starch and alcohol.

plants.name: Prickly Pear (Opuntia)
plants.description: A genus in the cactus family, characterized by its flat, fleshy pads (cladodes).
instruction: Extremely drought-tolerant. Plant in full sun and very well-draining soil.
benefits: An ornamental plant for arid gardens. The pads (nopales) and fruit (tuna) of some species are edible.

plants.name: Quinoa
plants.description: A flowering plant in the amaranth family grown as a crop primarily for its edible seeds.
instruction: A hardy crop that prefers cool temperatures and well-drained soil.
benefits: A highly nutritious, gluten-free pseudocereal, valued as a complete protein source.

plants.name: Ramie
plants.description: A flowering plant in the nettle family, one of the oldest fiber crops.
instruction: A perennial crop that produces a high number of stems. Requires a warm, humid climate.
benefits: Produces a strong natural fiber, known for its ability to hold shape and reduce wrinkling. It is similar to linen.

plants.name: Rapeseed
plants.description: A bright-yellow flowering member of the family Brassicaceae, cultivated mainly for its oil-rich seed.
instruction: A cool-season crop typically grown in rotation with cereals like wheat.
benefits: The source of canola oil for cooking and biodiesel fuel. The meal is used as animal feed.

plants.name: Rice
plants.description: A cereal grain that is the most widely consumed staple food for a large part of the world's human population.
instruction: Typically grown in flooded paddies, requiring significant water and a long, warm growing season.
benefits: Primary source of carbohydrates for billions. Used industrially for products like rice flour and sake.

plants.name: Rose
plants.description: A woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae.
instruction: Plant in a sunny location with rich, well-drained soil. Requires regular watering, fertilizing, and pruning.
benefits: One of the most popular and culturally significant ornamental flowers in the world.

plants.name: Rubber
plants.description: The rubber tree is a tall deciduous tree, the primary source of natural rubber.
instruction: Grown in large plantations in tropical climates with high rainfall.
benefits: The latex sap is harvested and processed into natural rubber, a critical industrial material.

plants.name: Rye
plants.description: A grass grown extensively as a grain, a cover crop, and a forage crop.
instruction: An extremely hardy cereal that can grow in poor soils and cold conditions.
benefits: Used to make rye bread, whiskey, and vodka. Also valued as a soil-improving cover crop.

plants.name: Safflower
plants.description: A highly branched, herbaceous, thistle-like annual plant.
instruction: A drought-tolerant crop grown in arid environments.
benefits: Cultivated for its oil, which is used for cooking. Your notes highlight its use in 'medicine & biofuel'.

plants.name: Screw Pine (Pandanus)
plants.description: A genus of palms or palm-like trees and shrubs, known for the spiral arrangement of their leaves.
instruction: Thrives in tropical and subtropical coastal areas.
benefits: The leaves are used for weaving mats, baskets, and other handicrafts, providing a durable fiber.

plants.name: Sedum
plants.description: A large genus of flowering plants, also known as stonecrops, typically with fleshy, water-storing leaves.
instruction: Generally hardy and easy to grow. They prefer full sun and well-drained soil.
benefits: Popular ornamental succulents for rock gardens, ground cover, and containers.

plants.name: Sesame
plants.description: A flowering plant in the genus Sesamum, cultivated for its edible seeds.
instruction: A drought-tolerant crop that grows well in tropical and subtropical regions.
benefits: The seeds are used whole in cooking or pressed to produce sesame oil, a flavorful cooking oil.

plants.name: Sesbania
plants.description: A genus of flowering plants in the pea family, known as nitrogen-fixing shrubs and trees.
instruction: Fast-growing plants that adapt to a wide range of soils, including waterlogged and saline conditions.
benefits: Valuable as a green manure crop to improve soil fertility and as nutritious fodder for livestock.

plants.name: Shatavari
plants.description: A species of asparagus common throughout Nepal, Sri Lanka, India, and the Himalayas.
instruction: A climbing plant that grows best in well-drained, fertile soil.
benefits: The roots are used in Ayurvedic medicine, primarily as a reproductive tonic for women.

plants.name: Silk Cotton Tree
plants.description: A large tropical tree with a straight trunk covered in spines, known for the cotton-like fiber in its seed pods.
instruction: A fast-growing tree that prefers tropical climates.
benefits: The fiber (kapok) is buoyant, water-resistant, and brittle, used as a stuffing for mattresses, pillows, and life jackets.

plants.name: Sisal
plants.description: A species of Agave, a hardy plant grown for its stiff fiber.
instruction: A drought-resistant plant that thrives in hot, arid climates.
benefits: The fiber is traditionally used for rope, twine, and other cordage.

plants.name: Snake Plant
plants.description: A species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae, known for its stiff, upright, sword-like leaves.
instruction: Extremely tolerant of low light and irregular watering. Plant in well-draining soil.
benefits: A very popular and low-maintenance houseplant. Your notes highlight it as an 'air purifier'.

plants.name: Sorghum
plants.description: A genus of flowering plants in the grass family, cultivated for grain and fodder.
instruction: A drought-tolerant crop that grows well in hot, arid regions.
benefits: The grain is a staple food in many parts of the world, and the entire plant is used as animal fodder.

plants.name: Soy Beans
plants.description: A species of legume native to East Asia, widely grown for its edible bean.
instruction: A warm-season crop that requires fertile soil and regular moisture.
benefits: A major global crop used for its high protein content and oil. Used to make tofu, soy milk, and animal feed. A key 'industrial plant' as noted.

plants.name: Spider Plant
plants.description: A flowering perennial herb with long, arching, grass-like leaves, known for producing baby spiderettes.
instruction: Very easy to grow. Prefers bright, indirect light and is adaptable to various conditions.
benefits: A classic, easy-to-propagate houseplant. Noted in your list as an 'air purifier'.

plants.name: Spinach
plants.description: A leafy green flowering plant native to central and western Asia.
instruction: A cool-season crop that grows best in moist, nitrogen-rich soil.
benefits: A highly nutritious vegetable, rich in iron, vitamins A and C, and antioxidants.

plants.name: Subabul (Leucaena leucocephala)
plants.description: A small, fast-growing mimosoid tree, known as a 'miracle tree' for its variety of uses.
instruction: A hardy, drought-resistant tree that can be grown in a wide range of soils.
benefits: Used for reforestation, firewood, and as a highly nutritious source of fodder for livestock.

plants.name: Sugarcane
plants.description: A species of tall, perennial grass that is used for sugar production.
instruction: A tropical plant that requires high temperatures and high rainfall to thrive.
benefits: The primary source of the world's sugar. Also used to produce molasses, rum, and biofuel (ethanol).

plants.name: Sunflower
plants.description: A large annual flower known for its bright, sun-like appearance and edible seeds.
instruction: Plant in a sunny location with well-drained soil. Provide support as they grow tall.
benefits: The seeds are a source of food and oil. Your notes highlight its application in 'making industrial medicine'.

plants.name: Syngonium (Arrowhead Plant)
plants.description: A genus of flowering plants in the arum family, popular as houseplants for their arrow-shaped leaves.
instruction: Prefers bright, indirect light and consistently moist soil. Can be grown as a bushy plant or a climbing vine.
benefits: An attractive and easy-care decorative plant, also considered to be an air purifier.

plants.name: Tamarind
plants.description: A leguminous tree bearing edible pod-like fruit, which contains a sweet, tangy pulp.
instruction: A long-lived, tropical tree that is tolerant of drought and wind.
benefits: The pulp is used in beverages, as a flavoring in cuisines around the world, and for 'medicinal purposes' as noted.

plants.name: Teak
plants.description: A tropical hardwood tree species, highly valued for its durable and water-resistant wood.
instruction: Grown in large plantations, requiring a tropical climate with a distinct dry season.
benefits: A premier timber used for high-end furniture, boat building, and exterior construction due to its durability.

plants.name: Tobacco
plants.description: A plant within the nightshade family, grown for its leaves which are dried and fermented before being put in tobacco products.
instruction: A nutrient-intensive crop that requires well-drained, fertile soil.
benefits: The primary industrial crop used for the production of cigarettes, cigars, and other tobacco products.

plants.name: Tomato
plants.description: The edible berry of the plant Solanum lycopersicum, a common garden vegetable.
instruction: A warm-season crop. Plant in full sun in rich, well-drained soil and provide support/staking.
benefits: A staple food ingredient used in countless dishes worldwide. A good source of Vitamin C and lycopene.

plants.name: Triticale
plants.description: A hybrid of wheat (Triticum) and rye (Secale).
instruction: Combines the yield potential of wheat with the disease tolerance and hardiness of rye.
benefits: Grown mostly as a forage crop for livestock, though some is used in health foods and baking.

plants.name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
plants.description: An aromatic perennial plant in the mint family, native to the Indian subcontinent.
instruction: Plant in a sunny location with well-drained soil. Water regularly but do not overwater.
benefits: A sacred plant in Hinduism, revered for its wide range of medicinal properties, particularly for reducing stress and boosting immunity.

plants.name: Turmeric
plants.description: A flowering plant of the ginger family, the rhizomes of which are used in cooking.
instruction: A tropical plant that requires warm temperatures and significant rainfall to thrive.
benefits: The ground rhizome is a primary spice in curry powders. It is also widely used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory compound, curcumin.

plants.name: Wheat
plants.description: A cereal grain which is a worldwide staple food.
instruction: A cool-season grass that is grown in a variety of climates worldwide.
benefits: The primary grain used for making bread, pasta, and a vast array of other food products.

plants.name: Yucca
plants.description: A genus of perennial shrubs and trees, notable for their rosettes of evergreen, tough, sword-shaped leaves.
instruction: Extremely drought-tolerant. Prefers full sun and sandy, well-drained soil.
benefits: A bold, architectural plant used in landscaping, especially in arid climates.

plants.name: ZZ Plant
plants.description: A flowering plant with smooth, naturally shiny leaves that is known for its tolerance of neglect.
instruction: Thrives on low light and infrequent watering. Allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.
benefits: An extremely low-maintenance houseplant. Your notes mention it is an 'air purifier' and is 'believed to attract positive energy'.
